name: Mantra on Northbourne Canberra

reviews.text: We had three people staying in a one bedroom unit. Unfortunately there was no entry to the bathroom from the living area so the third person had to go through the bedroom to get to the bathroom during the night.
reviews.title: Not as good as other Mantras

reviews.text: It cost $12 a night for parking, but by the time we got back to the hotel at 9.30pm there were no spots left and we had to park out on the street behind the hotel. Fortunately we didn't have to pay the fee.
reviews.title: Great location but no attention to detail

reviews.text: The view out of our 5th floor room was the black wall of the building next door... it was ugly.
reviews.title: Great Value, Large Rooms

reviews.text: We stayed here to visit our son who was working in Canberra. We took a one bedroom suite so we could utilise the fold out sofa bed for a family member travelling with us.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: The problems began when we requested extra pillows to use on the sofa bed. There were none available we were told because they were busy.
reviews.title: Good size rooms, great location

reviews.text: This is the third Mantra hotel I've stayed at and by far the worst. In fact it's been one of the worst hotels I've stayed at. The first room I stayed in had a broken dishwasher, some incredibly dirty glasses (see photos), a broken washing machine and in terms of knives it was decked out with two filleting knives (??), a cheese knife and a paring knife. Not very handy considering the rooms are decked out with ovens and what not. I was staying there for a week, so clearly all of the above wasn't satisfactory.
reviews.title: My mantra is never again

reviews.text: I'd changed rooms the next day and in that room the controls for the heater in the lounge wasn't working, the tv wasn't responding to the remote in the room or any of the remotes the attendant brought in, and finally the dryer wasn't working.
reviews.title: Great family getaway

reviews.text: The rooms are absolutely adequate and if you're looking for nothing more than a place to crash then you'd be happy I'm sure. But the bedding isn't all that great either.
reviews.title: Decent hotel close to the centre of Canberra

reviews.text: In terms of cleanliness, myself and the other friends who were also staying there had to clean most pots/pans before using them, and as mentioned the glassware was very dirty.
reviews.title: They charged my credit card for something I'd already paid for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In regards to amenities, the gym had a broken treadmill and a weight machine in disrepair (this seems to be standard at all Mantra hotels). The sauna had graffiti carved into the walls (why that wouldn't be noticed when cleaning and people doing so identified I really don't know), and the floor was pretty scummy.
reviews.title: A great weekend in Canberra

reviews.text: Stayed with a sporting team for 2 weeks. 4 of us shared a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment. enough room for everyone but limited space for hanging or storing clothes, was worse in 1 bedroom apartments. furniture had seen better days, holes in lounge covers & leg about to fall off table. shower in bath with no anti slip mat.
reviews.title: It does have a good location

reviews.text: agree with others about meals in restaurant & $12 parking. bathrooms & kitchen floors swept but not mopped. most front desk were very good but others seemed to want to be some place else.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was below par service for a Mantra hotel. The room was ok but the waiting, overcharging room fees and also charging for their mistakes made this an unpleasant experience for me.
reviews.title: Not worth it for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Having to wait an additional 2 hours for my room to be ready
reviews.title: Very dissapointing !!

reviews.text: -Using the dry cleaning service only to find they didnt return my clothes by the advertised time, which meant I had to continue my trip with no clean underwear.
reviews.title: Great 2 day stay

reviews.text: Just spent 5 nights in the Mantra on Northbourne and all i can say is, its average.
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.text: I stay in Canberra often but this was my first visit to the Mantra and hopefully my last
reviews.title: Very ordinary experience

reviews.text: I was in a king room, so king size bed and largish desk.
reviews.title: Really good, solid hotel - very comfy bed!

reviews.text: The room was dark and uninteresting. There were small windows but with the building next door quite close, it just always looks dingy and dark..
reviews.title: Rubbish

reviews.text: The room was comfortable enough, but with the proximity of the main road, a little noisy.
reviews.title: Noisy and a lot of light at night

description: All suite property w/ modern contemporary design & furnishings - 3 blks from city centre.
